events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on 2024-04-28 involving their vehicle and another party.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing initial claim details and accident description provided.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to guide the customer through the claims process and collect necessary information.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the claim and sent confirmation to the customer.
The agent requested supporting documents including the police report, photos of vehicle damage, and repair estimates.
Customer submitted all requested documents: police report, multiple photos showing car damage, and the repair shop estimate.
Investigation team started reviewing all submitted materials and began contacting involved parties for further details.
The investigation was completed, confirming the accident details and the extent of damages to the insured vehicle.
A settlement offer was proposed by the insurer based on the damage assessment and policy coverage limits.
The customer provided positive feedback about the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the communication so far.
Following acceptance of the settlement terms, the claim was officially approved by the insurance company.
The payment for the approved settlement was issued and transferred to the customer's account as per agreement.
The claim was formally closed after payment issuance and confirmation that the customer had no further questions.
All case documents and correspondence were archived securely as part of standard record-keeping procedures.
